Package com.dimitris.cryptoanalyze.controller

Class CryptoAnalyzerController

java.lang.Object
com.dimitris.cryptoanalyze.controller.CryptoAnalyzerController
@RestController @RequestMapping(path="/api/crypto/analyze") public class CryptoAnalyzerController extends Object
Controller providing REST endpoints through which user interacts with the application

  • Constructor Details

      @Autowired public CryptoAnalyzerController(CryptoAnalyzer cryptoAnalyzer)

  • Method Details

    • sortCryptosByNormalizedRangeDesc

      @PostMapping("/sort/by/normalized/desc") public CryptoMetricsListDto sortCryptosByNormalizedRangeDesc(@RequestBody Optional<TimePeriodRequestDto> timePeriodRequestDto) throws CryptoInternalException
      Returns a list of cryptos sorted by normalized price range in descending order
      Parameters:
      timePeriodRequestDto - Optional time period calculation applies to. If omitted, calculation has no time restriction. It contains two optional fields representing start and end time points. If any of them is omitted, calculation will be restricted only to the other point in time. If both are omitted, calculation has no time restriction.
      Returns:
      A list of mappings between crypto and its normalized range value (no mappings exist for cryptos for which no values are found)
      Throws:
      CryptoInternalException - Internal error during crypto data loading, manipulations or calculations

    • getMetricsForCrypto

      @PostMapping("/metrics/{crypto}") public CryptoMetricsDto getMetricsForCrypto(@PathVariable("crypto") String crypto, @RequestBody Optional<TimePeriodRequestDto> timePeriodRequestDto) throws CryptoInternalException, CryptoNotFoundException
      Returns a mapping of metrics to their corresponding values for the specified crypto
      Parameters:
      crypto - The crypto for which the metric values must be found
      timePeriodRequestDto - Optional time period calculation applies to. If omitted, calculation has no time restriction. It contains two optional fields representing start and end time points. If any of them is omitted, calculation will be restricted only to the other point in time. If both are omitted, calculation has no time restriction.
      Returns:
      A mapping of each metric to corresponding value (empty map if no values found for crypto)
      Throws:
      CryptoInternalException - Internal error during crypto data loading, manipulations or calculations
      CryptoNotFoundException - Requested crypto is not supported

    • getCryptoWithHighestNormalizedRange

      @PostMapping("/crypto/with/highest/normalized") public CryptoMetricDto getCryptoWithHighestNormalizedRange(@RequestBody Optional<TimePeriodRequestDto> timePeriodRequestDto) throws CryptoInternalException
      Returns the crypto with the highest normalized price range
      Parameters:
      timePeriodRequestDto - Optional time period calculation applies to. If omitted, calculation has no time restriction. It contains two optional fields representing start and end time points. If any of them is omitted, calculation will be restricted only to the other point in time. If both are omitted, calculation has no time restriction.
      Returns:
      A mapping of the crypto to its normalized range value (if no crypto data found, mapping contains null as values)
      Throws:
      CryptoInternalException - Internal error during crypto data loading, manipulations or calculations
